meanings.definition: An administrative district typically having its own church and a priest or pastor.
meanings.sent1: The small parish had a beautiful church at its center.
meanings.sent2: The parish council met every Sunday to discuss community matters.
meanings.sent3: The parish picnic was a fun event where everyone enjoyed delicious food.
meanings.sent4: In the heart of the parish, the church stood tall like a guardian.
meanings.sent5: The parish boundaries were clearly marked by the presence of the church.

meanings.definition: The members of a particular church community.
meanings.sent1: The parishioners gathered for a special service on Christmas Eve.
meanings.sent2: The parish welcomed new families with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The parish potluck dinner was a tasty way to bring everyone together.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, the parishioners supported each other like a family.
meanings.sent5: The parish community thrived on love and fellowship.

meanings.sent1: The small parish had a close-knit group of worshipers.
meanings.sent2: The parish choir sang beautifully during Sunday service.
meanings.sent3: The parish bake sale raised funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent4: The parish youth group organized a fun movie night.
meanings.sent5: The parish garden bloomed with colorful flowers in the spring.
